Title.evidence: Effect of Prophylactic Antibiotics on Intraoperative Cultures in Revision Arthroplasty: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: Eligibility required a culture-positive aspiration and no antibiotics within two weeks prior.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive prophylactic antibiotics either before skin incision or after obtaining a minimum of three sets of intraoperative cultures.

Objective.evidence: Background: Preoperative antibiotics are crucial for reducing periprosthetic joint infection (PJI) risk in primary total hip and knee arthroplasty (THA and TKA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the concordance of intraoperative and preoperative cultures, assessed immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This multicenter, prospective randomised controlled trial included 65 patients

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 65 randomised, 34 received antibiotics before incision, and 31 after culture collection.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intraoperative cultures matched preoperative cultures in 28/34 (82%) of the pre-incision group and 25/31 (81%) of the post-culture group, showing statistical equivalence (p = 0.0290).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
